Sentencas: This study evaluates two different scenarios of an integrated system to generate electricity for a charging station using proton exchange membrane fuel cell (PEMFC) and solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC).
Titulo: Electric vehicle charging station using fuel cell technology: Two different scenarios and thermodynamic analysis

Sentencas: To improve the efficiency, the exhaust heat of these two fuel cells are recovered by two different bottoming power cycles of Kalina Cycle (KC) and Organic Rankine Cycle (ORC).
Titulo: Electric vehicle charging station using fuel cell technology: Two different scenarios and thermodynamic analysis

Sentencas: The system is designed for a 100 kW charging station capable to charge five cars simultaneously, assuming a standard car used in daily life with a battery capacity of 36 kWh and a range of 220 km.
Titulo: Electric vehicle charging station using fuel cell technology: Two different scenarios and thermodynamic analysis

Sentencas: Thermodynamic analysis of the system is performed in different current densities from 0.5 A/cm(2) to 0.8 A/cm(2).
Titulo: Electric vehicle charging station using fuel cell technology: Two different scenarios and thermodynamic analysis

Sentencas: In the first scenario, results indicated that the overall energy efficiency of the system is 58.47% at 0.5 A/cm(2) and 49% at 0.8 A/cm(2), while that of the second scenario is 43.21% at 0.5 A/cm(2) and 35% at 0.8 A/cm(2).
Titulo: Electric vehicle charging station using fuel cell technology: Two different scenarios and thermodynamic analysis

Sentencas: To improve the dynamic response of the system, a high capacity battery and a supercapacitor were integrated to the fuel cell system.
Titulo: Electric vehicle charging station using fuel cell technology: Two different scenarios and thermodynamic analysis

Sentencas: It was found that a hybrid combination of the battery and supercapacitor improve the performance of the system.
Titulo: Electric vehicle charging station using fuel cell technology: Two different scenarios and thermodynamic analysis
